name: Time After Time
description:
Time After Time - A puzzle platformer about patience, timing, and memory.

You play as a character trying to escape from a dungeon. Run and jump across platforms towards the end of the room to get closer to escape. The twist? Time does not move normally in this special dungeon, and neither does your character.

As you move around the dungeon, your movements are recorded, forcing you to pay close attention to your each and every move, otherwise you may just end up in a pool of lava. Every few seconds, you enter the REWIND state and your recorded movements will be played back starting from your most recent move, in addition, you will only have a certain number of rewinds every room. When you run out of rewinds, your character will die.

When you first enter a room, you're given the ability to look around the room and plan your moves before the room timer begins.

CONTROLS

AD - Movement

Space - Jump

Of the four levels that I had the time for, I found most of them to be pretty challenging, especially the last one, which took forever to playtest.

All assets aside from the music are original assets.

MUSIC:

https://opengameart.org/content/dark-theme

~Made for Brackeys Game Jam 4~
